definition: to shift to an earlier date/to do sth ahead of time/in advance
to carry (hanging down from the hand)/to lift/to put forward/to mention/to raise (an issue)/upwards character stroke/lifting brush stroke (in painting)/scoop for measuring liquid
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: And I heard it helps to have funding in advance too.
sentences.chinese: 而且我聽說這也有助於提前得到資助。

sentences.english: The survey principle of a magneto ignition system ignition advance angle was introduced.
sentences.chinese: 本文介紹了磁電機點火系統的點火提前角測量原理。

sentences.english: The pamphlet suggests getting off the bus or train one stop early.
sentences.chinese: 小冊子建議，我們應該提前一站下汽車或者地鐵。

sentences.english: Now it’s time to preplan your trip.
sentences.chinese: 現在，是時候提前計劃你的行程了。

sentences.english: Next station is Wangjing, please get ready for your arrival.
sentences.chinese: 列車運行前方，是望京站，下車乘客請提前做好準備。

sentences.english: The leading group is to move back at5 minutes' notice.
sentences.chinese: 先頭小組何時返回，提前五分鐘通知。

sentences.english: At a Chinese party the guests usually arrive 5-10 minutes early.
sentences.chinese: 中餐宴會客人凡是提前五至非常鍾到達。

sentences.english: He said he hoped rumours that Brown would quit would come true.
sentences.chinese: 他希望布朗因爲身體原因提前辭職的傳言成真。

sentences.english: Knowing this ahead of time can help you avoid service disruptions.
sentences.chinese: 提前知道這些信息能幫助您避免服務中斷。

sentences.english: The film flashed forward to show us the result of her decision.
sentences.chinese: 影片提前向我們敘述了她的決定所產生的結果。

sentences.english: Batter can be made a day before and stored in refrigerator!
sentences.chinese: 可以提前一天做好麪糊，放在冰箱裏就行。

sentences.english: During the voyage, he was terribly seasick and deported back to his home ahead of time.
sentences.chinese: 因航行途中暈船厲害，被提前遣送回鄉。

sentences.english: The departure date of your group is the day after tomorrow, you want to check out early?
sentences.chinese: 您整團的離店時間是後天，您是要提前離店嗎？

sentences.english: The enterprises that have real transactions and need to pay foreign exchange to the outside shall be allowed to purchase foreign exchanges in advance.
sentences.chinese: 允許有真實交易背景需對外支付的企業提前購匯。

sentences.english: Be sure to book rooms well in advance.
sentences.chinese: 所以一定要提前預訂好房間。

sentences.english: We'll need you to sign a credit card voucher in advance.
sentences.chinese: 你們需要提前籤一下信用卡的單據。

definition: ahead of schedule/sooner than planned/to bring forward (to an earlier time)
preparation/to prepare/to intend/to be about to/reserve (fund)
at once/right away/immediately/on horseback (i.e. by military force)
at any time/at all times/at the right time
to wait until/by the time when (sth is ready etc)
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
